intro: Synedrella peduncularis, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Synedrella peduncularis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
